page.title: 20DIALECT USAGE IN SANDWICK
page.content:
There is a local Shetland dialect which is used amongst the people of Shetland although when talking to people from outwith the islands and at school, English is spoken. The dialect is derived from Norse, Lowland Scots and English. This shows the close links with the Scandinavian countries in centuries past and in more recent times with the Scots and the English. Examples of dialect words peerie - small callyshang - noisy dispute argie-bargie - quarrel moorie -cavie - blizzard
Written by the pupils and teachers of the primary department of Sandwick Junior High School.
